biography.content: Orion Reyes was born in Aguascalientes, Mexico in 1979. He received his Bachelor of Engineer degree in Electrical Mechanics in 2003, and his Master degree in Computer Science in 2005, both from the Technological Institute of Apizaco, Mexico. In 2004 He participated as a research assistant at the East University of Santiago de Cuba, Cuba with the Voice Processing Group in the field of Automatic Infant Cry Classification. In 2006 he joined the Department of Computer Engineering at the Autonomous University of Tlaxcala, Mexico, becoming a full-time professor in 2007. In 2010 he received a Scholarship from the Mexican National Council for Science and Technology to study at the University of Alberta, Canada with Dr. Witold Pedrycz. He received the title of PhD Candidate in 2012, and has not yet concluded the PhD program. His areas or expertise are Infant Cry Analysis, Optimization by using evolutionary approaches, neural networks, Granular Computing and Fuzzy Logic.
